name: Cut Nib Calligraphy - Calligraphy Workshop
description:
25th & 26th January 2025 - 2-Day Workshop - 6 Hours of Training - 2 Scripts
Cut Nib Calligraphy traces its roots back centuries, to ancient civilizations such as the Greeks, Romans, and Chinese, who used vivid chisel-tipped writing instruments to inscribe their languages and artistic expressions onto various surfaces.
Fast forward to the modern era, Cut Nib Calligraphy continues to thrive as both a traditional craft and a contemporary art form. Today, artists and enthusiasts worldwide explore its expressive potential, blending traditional techniques with modern innovations to create stunning works of calligraphy art in this 2-day workshop!
What you will learn from this workshop:
-Origin of Calligraphy
-The meaning behind this art
-Introduction to Tools
-Understanding Stroke Variations
-Exploring & Learning Two Letter Forms: Roman & Gothic
-Promoting Continued Practise post workshop
Whether you`re a seasoned calligrapher or a curious beginner, this workshop offers an opportunity to refine your skills and discover more about Calligraphy
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated
This workshop includes all materials if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board

name: Windows to a Mountain - Poetry Reading
description: Snehal is a poet based in Dharamshala, where he also guides treks and cycle tours. Join us as he reads from his first collection of poems, Windows to a Mountain.

name: Meaning in the Moment: Exploring Logotherapy - Logotherapy Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and Dr. Divyanshi warmly invite you to embark on this fun and insightful journey of re-perception through this Logotherapy Workshop called “Meaning in the Moment”.
Logotherapy, founded by Viktor Frankl, is not merely a therapeutic technique—it is a philosophy of living that centers around finding meaning in life, even amidst suffering. Rooted in existential analysis, it goes beyond the immediate question of “what makes me happy?” and instead asks, “what gives my life purpose?” In this Logotherapy Workshop, we’ll explore the fundamental principles of logotherapy and how they can empower you to reshape your perspective and find deeper meaning in your life experiences.
Throughout the two-hour workshop, you’ll delve into the origins of logotherapy, key logotherapy techniques for uncovering meaning in your day-to-day life, and participate in dynamic, facilitated group games. These exercises are designed to foster reflection and may lead you to discover the clarity or ‘aha’ moments you’ve been seeking. You’ll walk away with a new lens through which to view your past and present experiences, gaining insight into how meaning can be found in all circumstances, even the most challenging ones.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is for anyone feeling a sense of stagnation, searching for a greater sense of purpose, or looking to make sense of life’s difficulties from a broader, more meaningful perspective. Open to anyone aged 16 and above, no prior background in psychology is needed—just an open mind and a curiosity to explore the deeper meaning of life.
Workshop Objectives:
•⁠ ⁠To introduce participants to the core concepts of Logotherapy and Viktor Frankl’s philosophy.
•⁠ ⁠To provide practical techniques for finding and creating meaning in daily life.
•⁠ ⁠To encourage introspection and group sharing that can lead to moments of personal clarity and insight
•⁠ ⁠To create a safe, supportive space for meaningful discussions and individual growth.
Community Guidelines:
•⁠ ⁠Approach the workshop with openness, curiosity, and kindness.
•⁠ ⁠Respect each participant’s unique perspective and journey.
•⁠ ⁠Engage in thoughtful, supportive, and constructive conversations.
DO CARRY A NOTEBOOK AND A PEN
We aim to create a focused and intimate experience, allowing for personalized attention, deeper engagement, and meaningful reflection.

name: 1000 Days of Love - Weekly Book Reading Sessions
description:
What is it? TDOL Secret Sessions is a one-of-a-kind event series to give you a front-row seat to the upcoming novel, 1000 Days of Love. In each session, the author will read two chapters and get your feedback in real time, while you get to meet like-minded people and build lifelong connections. 
Who is doing it? This event is hosted by the novel's author, Soundarya Balasubramani. She's a 2x author, founder of an American startup, renowned speaker, and influencer. Find her on LinkedIn and Instagram.
Why? Products have "launches" where they get user feedback to iterate and improve. Why not a book too? 
When? Ten sessions are hosted beginning January 11th, 2025 - February 9th, 2025, every Saturday and Sunday afternoon.
Where?  Atta Galatta- The Bookstore (178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038)
We're only choosing 25 people per session. Spots are limited. Please apply below and we'll be in touch :) Let's create some magic together ✨
***DETAILS***

🕒 Duration: 90 minutes
📍 Location: Atta Galatta - The Bookstore, Bangalore, India
🎟️ Cost: Free of cost + Free food and refreshments + Incentives (Receive a free copy of the book when you attend 2 or more sessions, and earn an exclusive TDOL T-shirt 👕 by joining 5 or more sessions! 😊✨)

name: Dalit Representation in South Indian Cinema - Talk
description:
Ambedkar Reading Circle, Bangalore, invites you to this talk that will touch upon the history of Dalit representation in South Indian cinema, examining its evolution through various themes, including caste and Dalit issues. It will majorly delve into contemporary South Indian cinema and its portrayal of Dalit identities, highlighting the significant representation of Dalit narratives in Tamil cinema and the emerging New Wave.
Apeksha Singegol is a Research Scholar with UGC-JRF in Sociology at CHRIST (Deemed to be University), Bangalore. Her research focuses on Caste, Dalit studies, and the Sociology of Media and Popular Culture, currently working on Dalit narratives in cinema. She has published articles in The Indian Express, The Mooknayak, and The Round Table India. Apeksha has also presented at national and international conferences and interned at the Dr. Ambedkar International Centre, Delhi.

name: Unscramble JANUARY - January Storytelling Meetup for Adults
description:
The new year is here and as we fill our minds with hopes and dreams for a wonderful year ahead, BSS wishes you all a very happy new year!
We wanted to start off this year with a playful teaser theme! And here it is… All you have to do is Unscramble the letters of JANUARY, create as many new words from the jumbled letters, and bring a story based on any one word. 
We loved doing this exercise and we are sure you will love it too! 
Once you have a story and you wish to tell, write to us your storyline, and the word that triggered that story.
We are already excited to see the different genre that you all are going to bring this month. 🙂🙂🙂
Remember, there is no storyteller without an audience. So if you feel like joining us as a listener, you are most welcome! 
The meet up is FREE so don't forget to get your friends too. The more the merrier. 🥳 🎉 
Send us the synopsis of your storyline to
bangalorestorytellingsociety@gmail.com by 21st January.
About BSS 
BSS is a not-for-profit organization established in the year 2013 by like-minded story lovers with the sole idea of reviving and promoting the oral storytelling traditions in India. The monthly meet-up for adults by the BANGALORE STORYTELLING SOCIETY, that began in 2013, aims to revive the traditional way of sharing tales amidst a gathering.  This is one of the longest running meetups in India.
Any questions? We are glad to help. WhatsApp: 9845680816

name: BWW Short Story Community - Literary Meetup
description:
The BWW Short Story Community
This month we will discuss The Woman Who Lost Her Head by Madhavi Mahadevan from Hell Hath No Fury (ed. Shinie Antony). 
What this is:
This is a ticketed, curated literary and community event, presented by Bhumika Anand from the Bangalore Writers Workshop, where we will do a deep-dive analysis and discussion of a short story.
You get to join a reading community where you will get to read a pre-chosen short story a month.
You get to examine the story in terms of its literary merit, yes, but also in terms of writing craft and context, which will be very useful if you are an aspiring storyteller or writer.
Who should join:
If you are above 18 years old, interested in storytelling, literature, or are an aspiring or published author, this is for you.
If you are new in the city and want to be part of a community and make friends over writing,storytelling, and literature, then this is for you.
What does it entail:
Reading the prescribed story.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Let Poetry Be - Poetry Open Mic
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - “Passage of Time”
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 26th December, midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for - under the stars'
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com

name: Woman and the Moon - Book Launch
description:
The moon is worshipped as a living goddess across many cultures, be in Greek, Roman, Chinese, or Egyptian. In the Greco-Roman tradition, the moon is known by various names, such as Cynthia, Diana, and Selene, whereas Egyptians prayed to Isis as the moon goddess. Isis is also the mother of the ancient religion of Wicca, a philosophy Jagari was deeply influenced by, in the form in which it is practised in India. She was introduced to Wicca by poet Rajorshi Patranabis, a senior Wiccan whom she fondly calls Rajorshi Da. Subsequently, she attended classes taught by the Wiccan High Priestess, Ipsita Roy Chakraverti. She was drawn to this ideal, at the core of which lies the honoring of the feminine energy, or Shakti. Needless to add, she was smitten by the moon goddess.
In November 2023, Rajorshi Da tagged Jagari in a social media post challenging her to complete 10 poems in 10 days. The fates conspired and her first poem was titled "Woman and the Moon." Once she started writing, she found that she could not stop. Hence, were born these 70 poems with the moon at the center. However, other than the woman and the moon, there is a third character—the "you" or the (male) lover whom the woman addresses. These three characters come together in a symphony in each of the poems. The woman is the “I” of the poem, the man is the “you”, and the moon is a omniscient presence. The tenor of every poem varies according to the lights and shadows of the woman's moods.
And so, dear reader, we welcome you to enjoy the shimmering pageant of  "Woman and the Moon."

name: Waking Up To A Dream - Book Signing
description: Waking up to Dream, is a remarkable collection by debut author Ruchi Raveendran. This book offers a poetic and visual journey into a quintessentially Indian way of life, blending slice-of-life short stories, evocative poems, and captivating paintings. As its back cover beautifully sets the tone: "Once upon a time, in the past, present, or future, is a village..."

name: Murder at Midnight - An Immersive Crime Solving Experience
description:
Do you like murder mysteries? Ever wanted to take a crack at solving one? Well, here’s your chance! Using clues, examination and deductions, solve an original murder mystery and find the perpetrator among you! Join us for this immersive crime solving experience on 25th January 2025.
From Varun Gwalani, the author of locked-room murder mystery The Only Way Out is Death, comes an original murder mystery that you can participate in!
Inspired by the fictional detectives from the novel, this interactive game features 20 unique characters, all suffering from amnesia surrounding a recent murder. Work together with your fellow detectives, piece by piece, to uncover the truth while navigating red herrings and the possibility that one of your own is the cunning killer 👀

name: Nagrota Under Seige - Book Signing
description:
On 29 November 2016, the Nagrota Army Base in Jammu and Kashmir was attacked by a group of terrorists. The highly trained and heavily armed terrorists had infiltrated from across the LoC and gained entry from the forest behind the camp. Firing mercilessly to cause maximum damage, they were on a revenge mission after the Indian Army's successful surgical strikes on terror camps just two months earlier. The Indian Army personnel inside the camp played a crucial role in securing the lives of those present in the family accommodations as well as the camp, and many bravely laid down their lives. Nagrota Under Siege, the book, is the story of grit, courage and unmatched bravery.
Join us to meet the author, Bhaavna Arora, at Atta Galatta, on 26th January at 12 PM and to get your copies signed!

name: Mindful Moves - Movement Workshop
description:
Mindful Moves is a unique practice founded by Sreya Ridhiban, offering dance movement therapy that focuses on mind-body connection and trauma healing. It provides a safe space to unwind, learn, unlearn, and destress. Each session incorporates sound healing, card pulling, and somatic practices, delivering a holistic approach to mental and physical well-being.
In today’s world, prioritizing mental health is as important as physical health. Movement plays a significant role in releasing trauma stored in the body, and Mindful Moves embraces this philosophy. You don’t have to be a dancer to move—this space is for everyone.

name: Wandering Thoughts - Reflection Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other`s experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Chapter Carnival - Library Meetup
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View On Books, A Novel Club cordially invite you to the latest Library Meetup in town.
Join us for a innovative Library Meet wherein there`s over hundreds of books and you could pick a book in random and start reading together.
Have an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Come along with Empty Minds and fill it with rich literature from Atta Galatta’s Reading Section.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Reading minimum one chapter from a random book that you choose from the libary.
Participating in the ensuing curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: Allegory of the Crab - Book Launch
description:
Discover Resilience and Healing Through Nature at the Launch of book “Allegory of the Crab” 
Acclaimed mental wellness coach, psychologist, and author Geetha Solaraj is proud to announce the launch of her debut book, “Allegory of the Crab” - Resilient Currents, Life Lessons from the Crab’s Journey. This deeply personal and inspirational book explores themes of resilience, healing, and growth, using powerful allegories from nature to shed light on life’s challenges.
Drawing from her own battle with cancer and her experiences as a counselling psychologist, Geetha Solaraj weaves together reflections, anecdotes, and poetic expressions to offer readers a guide to navigating life’s storms. The book connects the journey of the crab—an emblem of adaptability and strength—to our own lives, reminding us that we too have the capacity to rebuild, grow, and thrive no matter what challenges we face.
Key Highlights of the Book:

Nature as a Teacher: Explore how lessons from nature and the animal kingdom, particularly the crab, can inspire us to adapt, evolve, and overcome.
The Power of the Mind-Body Connection: Insights into understanding how our physical health often mirrors unresolved emotional and psychological conflicts.
Personalized Healing Journeys: Encouragement to discover and embrace unique paths to healing, recognizing that no two journeys are alike.
Poetry for the Soul: Heartfelt poems penned during Geetha’s most challenging times, offering comfort and hope to readers.

“As someone who has faced a life-altering illness, I’ve come to realize that resilience is not just about enduring hardships but also about adapting and finding strength in unexpected places,” says Geetha Solaraj. “This book is my attempt to share those lessons and inspire others to look within, listen to their bodies, and embrace their unique journeys toward healing.”
A Message of Hope and Resilience
Resilient Currents is more than just a book—it’s a reflection of the human spirit and its incredible ability to thrive despite adversity. Geetha’s heartfelt storytelling and profound insights make this book a valuable resource for anyone navigating life’s challenges, whether it’s a health crisis, personal transformation, or emotional upheaval.
About the Author
Geetha Solaraj is an Master NLP Mental Wellness coach and Counselling Psychologist specializing in stress reduction, communication improvement, and support for those battling cancer or caregiving. Her own transformative journey—from being a cancer survivor to a guiding light for others—has shaped her unique perspective on resilience and healing. Through her writing and workshops, Geetha continues to inspire countless individuals to embrace their strength and live fulfilling lives.
Join the Journey
We invite readers to explore Resilient Currents and discover powerful lessons about life, healing, and the beauty of the human spirit. Whether you’re seeking inspiration, guidance, or a fresh perspective, this book is a testament to the resilience we all carry within ourselves.

name: Tumhaare Baare Mein - Theatre Performance
description:
This play focuses on modern relationships and the complexities and the dilemmas which come with it. It emphasises on the voids and the fantasies which come with the differences in partners and how current relationships need a therapy and social media validation to achieve a sense of completion.
Show times are as follows:
8th February:
4:00PM - 6:00PM
7:00PM - 9:00PM
9th February:
7:00PM - 9:00PM

name: Find Your Voice - Theatre Performance
description:
The "Find Your Voice" workshop is a four-hour intensive designed to help stage artists and aspiring performers discover, refine, and enhance their vocal abilities. Voice is one of the most critical tools for a performer, and this workshop delves into the essential elements of posture, breathing, sound production, and projection to equip participants with techniques for delivering powerful and sustainable performances.
Key Sections of the Workshop
1. Foundations of Voice and Posture
Posture and Alignment
Warm-Up and Body Awareness
2. Breathing Techniques for Vocal Power
Understanding Breath Control
Practical Breathing Exercises
Breath and Movement Coordination
3. Unlocking Vocal Potential
Expanding Vocal Range
Articulation and Resonance
Vocal Health
4. Voice Projection and Emotional Expression
Projection Techniques
Expressing Emotion Through Voice

name: Manga Mochas - Manga and Comics Fan Meet
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books, Novel Club cordially invite you to the unique Manga Mochas, fans meet for Comics & Manga readers.
Are you a Manga maven or a comic connoisseur? Have you ever wanted to share your passion, connect with like-minded enthusiasts, and debate the finer points of your favorite stories? Well, your wait is over!
Calling all voracious readers of Manga, comics, and graphic novels! Join us for an exhilarating in-person meet-up where you can express YOUR views, discuss your beloved series, and meet fellow aficionados!
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolising the conversation.
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza: Kick things off with a fun game and introduce yourself. Let`s warm up the crowd!
2. Manga Mochas: Step into the spotlight for 5-7 minutes and share your passion for your favorite Manga or comic. No slides, just pure enthusiasm!
INTERMISSION: Chill & Chat
3. Fun & Games: Prepare for laughs with another engaging game.
4. What’s Next? Discuss and vote on the next Manga, comic, or graphic novel we’ll dive into!
5. Special Surprise Activity: Stay tuned for an exciting twist!
6. Photo Op: Say "cheese" for our group picture!
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Your February Story - Playback Theatre Performance
description:
Your February Story (Playback Theatre by Threads and Tales/ Lahe Lahe Caravan) 🌸
After the fresh start to the year or the overwhelming pressure to start something new in January settles, What does February mean to you? Is it a season of love and connection, a time for self-discovery, or perhaps a memory of solitude, longing, or celebration? Join us for *`Your February Story`*, a Playback Theatre experience where your stories take center stage.
Through live, improvised performances, we’ll bring to life the many shades of February—moments of love, reflections on relationships, the coziness of winter, the joys/sorrows of being a shorter month or memories that this special month holds for you. Whether your February feels like a tender embrace or a quiet pause, this is a space for you to share, connect, and reflect and see us perform it back for you!
Threads and Tales is a Playback theatre group started by Lahe Lahe Caravan created to bring real life stories to life through theatre, music and movement
Artists for the show:
Actors: Shraddha M, Shruthi V, Divyanshi G, Siddharth C, Ananya
Musicians: Nikhil S, Arkapraba G
Facilitator/ Conductor: Mansee S
Don’t miss an evening of heartfelt stories, shared emotions, and the magic of storytelling!
performer:
Lahe Lahe Caravan, 
Threads and Tales,

name: Tumhaare Baare Mein - Theatre Performance
description:
This play focuses on modern relationships and the complexities and the dilemmas which come with it. It emphasises on the voids and the fantasies which come with the differences in partners and how current relationships need a therapy and social media validation to achieve a sense of completion.
Show times are as follows:
8th February:
4:00PM - 6:00PM
7:00PM - 9:00PM
9th February:
7:00PM - 9:00PM

name: Acupuncture Healing Energy Bootcamp - Wellness Workshop
description:
Join us for an eye-opening and heart-opening session of healing at Atta Galatta!
In this session you will:
Learn about the ancient Chinese system of healing known as Acupuncture
Understand how blocked and imbalanced energies in our bodies could lead to chronic physical and emotional ailments
Get personalized treatment to unblock and balance your energies (no needles involved)
Have an intense guided journalling and meditation session to uncover inner wounds and heal them
Get tips for a more balanced life
Ideal for those who suffer from recurring physical ailments, those who seek to break recurring unhealthy behavioural patterns, those seeking relief from stress and anxiety and for curious souls looking to understand their bodies and minds better.
Participants are requested to wear loose and comfortable clothing as we will be doing some light stretches during the session.
Please bring along a pen and a bottle of water.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
February Read: : The Flavours of Nationalism by Nandita Haksar
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: Poetic Brew - Poetry Meetup
description:
Gather, Poetic Souls, for an afternoon divine, where verses entwine and words intertwine. In this literary realm, hearts open wide, For a Poetry Meet, let passion be our guide.
Inviting all Poetry enthusiasts 📚 to an In-Person Meet where you can indulge in creative poetry writing and reading session. 
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza - Intro yourself & let`s play an interesting fun Game to break ice cubes.
2. Poet`s Spotlight: Write a poem based on an innovative prompt letting your thoughts engage.
<-- INTERMISSION: CHILL & CHAT -->
3. Recital Stage: Take center stage for 5-7 minutes, discuss the verse that`s touched your head. As you share your verse, let passion reign.
4. Verse of the Month & What Lies Ahead - Vote for the next Poetry Book to read.
5. Say Butter - Click that Snap button for a group picture.
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolising the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Women's Sound and Art Workshop - Wellness Workshop
description:
Great things happen when women connect.
Sound is the source of this entire creation.
Did you know that the sound of the musical notes have a profoundly positive impact on our chakras?
Whether you receive the sounds from sacred singing bowls meant for the purpose of healing or well-being, or you sing the notes yourself, they bring in a sense of balance.
As this balance fosters feelings of joy and peace, it can aid creative expression in many forms.
Painting is one such creative form that is closely associated with sound and music. The choice of colours, mood and theme, sensory and emotional experience while painting gets influenced by the presence of sound and music in the environment where art is taking place impacting the artistic process and the final creation.
Inspired by this, we have a similar collaboration with artists Shilpi, Ayuushi, Priyanka and Khusbu who aspire to hold a Sound & Art Workshop for women wishing to experience such intense joy and creativity on 8th March 2025, International Women’s Day.
It would be a treat to observe the participants flow with the sounds and express their art.
Take away:
Painting to add vibrancy to your room or your living. An ideal gift that you can make, gift and surprise anyone.
This is a wonderful opportunity to receive encouragement from peer women.
What to Bring:

Yoga mat.
Shawl / stole.
Drinking water bottle.

No prior art experience is necessary.
Participants should come with an open mind. All other materials will be provided.
Wear comfortable, light color cotton / linen clothing as absorbing the vibrations is easier.
Registration: Spaces are limited, so early registration is encouraged.
performer:
Ayuushi, 
Khusbu Goyal, 
Priyanka Sinha, 
Shilpi,
